newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Train hits Russia school bus, killing 17 children.
newsitem.headline: Train hits Russia school bus, killing 17 children.

text.p: Seventeen children were killed on Thursday when a locomotive struck a school bus at a level crossing in Russia's southern Rostov region, the Ministry for Emergency Situations said.
Accidents on unguarded crossings are common in Russia.
The ministry said the group of children aged 10 to 15 was on the way to school in the village of Kagalnitskaya about 30 km (20 miles) out of Rostov-on-Don.
Fifteen were killed immediately and two died later in hospital. Fourteen children and three adults hurt in the accident were treated in a local hospital.
The ministry said that a team of doctors was on stand-by to fly to the region if local hospitals needed assistance.
